title: Annual Health Checkup
summary: Annual health checkup with comprehensive metabolic panel and cholesterol screening. Patient has good cholesterol levels overall, with low HDL that needs improvement. Fasting glucose is 106 and A1C is 5.4 (approaching pre-diabetic range). Patient advised to reduce carbohydrates, moderate protein intake, and increase exercise. Additional labs ordered for thyroid, vitamin B12, vitamin D, and immunity titers.

reason_for_visit.description: Routine preventive care and health screening

details.title: Low HDL (High Density Lipoprotein)
details.description: HDL is 42, needs to be greater than 50 for males

details.title: Elevated fasting glucose
details.description: Fasting glucose is 106, within normal range but could be lower. A1C is 5.4, which is 0.3 away from pre-diabetic range (5.7)

details.title: Slightly elevated total protein
details.description: Total protein from liver is slightly high, possibly due to high protein intake from shakes or supplements

todos.title: Thyroid Level Test
todos.description: Monitor thyroid function to ensure normal hormone stimulation. Family history of thyroid issues noted.

todos.title: Vitamin B12 and Vitamin D
todos.description: Check vitamin B12 and vitamin D levels

todos.title: Immunity Titers (MMR and Varicella)
todos.description: Check for antibodies to determine immunity status. If not immune, boosters will be provided.

todos.title: Hepatitis B and Hepatitis C
todos.description: Check hepatitis B and hepatitis C through blood test

todos.title: COVID-19 and Flu Booster
todos.timing: Scheduled for Friday or can be taken today

todos.title: Tdap (Tetanus, Diphtheria, Pertussis) Booster
todos.description: If last tetanus shot was more than 10 years ago, get a booster. Patient to check records from India to determine when last received. Tetanus protection lasts for 10 years.

todos.title: Dietary changes - Reduce carbohydrates and moderate protein
todos.description: Reduce carbohydrate intake to help lower fasting glucose and A1C. Check online calorie count recommendations and moderate protein intake as total protein levels are slightly elevated. Everything in moderation.

todos.title: Increase HDL through diet
todos.description: Increase good cholesterol (HDL) through plant-based sources: salmon, nuts (avoid excessive peanuts), avocado oil, olive oil. Patient is vegan so focus on plant-based options.

todos.title: Increase exercise
todos.description: Add more exercise to help with overall cardiovascular health and glucose control. Patient has not been exercising in the last two months.

todos.title: Physical therapy for posture and alignment
todos.description: Patient experiencing dull pain from computer work (8 hours daily) and wrist tension. Try 4-5 PT sessions at Crossover facility. If issues don't resolve, follow up with doctor for potential referral.

follow_up.description: Annual checkup and repeat comprehensive metabolic panel, cholesterol screening. Monitor A1C and glucose levels to ensure they're trending in the right direction with lifestyle modifications.
If physical therapy doesn't resolve back and wrist issues after 4-5 sessions, schedule appointment to discuss further treatment options and potential referral.

learnings.title: Cholesterol components
learnings.description: Total cholesterol breaks down into HDL (good cholesterol), LDL (bad cholesterol), triglycerides, and other components. Total cholesterol should be less than 200, HDL should be greater than 50 for males, LDL should be less than 100, and triglycerides should be less than 150.

learnings.title: A1C test
learnings.description: A1C tells average blood sugar level over the past 2-3 months. Above 5.7 is pre-diabetic, above 6.4 is diabetic. Cannot be manipulated by short-term fasting before the test.

learnings.title: Comprehensive metabolic panel
learnings.description: Includes sodium, potassium, CO2, chloride, glucose, calcium, BUN and creatinine (kidney function markers), ALP and total protein (liver function markers).

learnings.title: Exercise and cholesterol
learnings.description: Exercise helps make blood vessels more flexible and keeps things moving, rather than directly increasing HDL. Important to avoid sedentary lifestyle.

learnings.title: Tdap vaccine
learnings.description: Tdap covers tetanus, diphtheria, and pertussis. Tetanus protection lasts for 10 years and boosters are needed if last dose was more than 10 years ago.
